## dNBR

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(raster)
```

```{r}
dnbr <- raster::raster("data/ltr/dnbr.tif")
raster::plot(dnbr)

# Convert to df and remove NA 
raw <- as.data.frame(dnbr, xy= TRUE) |> 
  filter(!is.na(dnbr))
```


```{r}
d <- raw |> 
  mutate(severity = 
           cut(dnbr, 
               breaks = c(-Inf, -.251, -.101, .099, 
                               .269, .439, .659, Inf),
               labels = c(
                 "Regrowth High", "Regrowth Low", "Unburned", 
                 "Low Severity", "Moderate Low Severity", 
                 "Moderate High Severity", "High Severity")
               ))



reclass_df <- 
  c(-Inf, -.251, -2,
    -.251, -.101, -1,  
    -.101, .099, 0,  
    .099, .269, 1,  
    .269, .439, 2, 
    .439, .659, 3,  
    .659, Inf, 4)

reclass_df <- 
  c(-Inf, -.251, -2, "Regrowth High", 
    -.251, -.101, -1, "Regrowth Low",
    -.101, .099, 0, "Unburned",
    .099, .269, 1, "Low Severity",
    .269, .439, 2, "Moderate Low Severity",
    .439, .659, 3, "Moderate High Severity",
    .659, Inf, 4, "High Severity")




effis_df <- 
  c(-Inf, 0.1, 0, 
    0.1, 0.255, 1, 
    0.255, 0.41, 2,
    0.41, 0.66, 3, 
    0.66, Inf, 4)
    
# 0 = "Unburned/Very Low"
# 1 = "Low"
# 2 = "Moderate"
# 3 = "High"
# 4 = "Very High"

# https://effis.jrc.ec.europa.eu/about-effis/technical-background/rapid-damage-assessment 
reclass_m <- matrix(effis_df, 
                    ncol = 3, byrow = TRUE) 

dnbr_reclas <- raster::reclassify(dnbr, reclass_m)
plot(dnbr_reclas)
```
